item.title: TE Flap Drive System – No-Coast Drag Brake

numlitem.para: Flap Drive Torque Tube and No-Coast Drag Brake support bracket are verified to be undamaged before each departure,
Flap control handle remains in agreement with flap position when hydraulics are unpressurized and Alternate Flaps Arm Switch remains OFF during ground operations in the terminal ramp area, and
Repairs are made within three flight days.

placard.para: Placard near alternate flap switch on center instrument panel: "ALTN FLAPS ARM SWITCH – LEAVE OFF IN RAMP AREA". Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: The repetitive inspection required when this item is inoperative must be documented in the Aircraft Logbook at the prescribed intervals. (Refer to GMM, Chapter 3, Section 6.)

maintenance.para: Prior to each flight, the following verification procedure must be accomplished:

numlitem.para: Examine the Flap Drive Torque Tube at its connection to the No-Coast Drag Brake. Ensure that there is no evidence of damage.
Examine the Flap Drive Torque Tube where it passes through the body to wing air seal. Ensure that there is no evidence of damage.
Examine the No-Coast Drag Brake. Ensure that there is no evidence of damage to its support bracket.

maintenance.para: If there is abnormal wear or damage evident, dispatch is not allowed.
